bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 12, 1893

div1.p: Lazear continues his visit to the World's Columbian Exposition in Chicago. He arranges for his trip to New York.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 12, 1893
div1.opener:
TOWER HOTEL,
STONY ISLAND AVENUE,
NEAR
65TH ST. ENTRANCE TO WORLD'S FAIR,
H. T. BLAKE, MANAGER,
LATE PROPRIETOR IRON SPRINGS HOTEL,
MANITOU, COL. AND MEXICAN GULF HOTEL,
PASS CHRISTIAN, MISS.
CHICAGO. Sep. 12 1893.
My dear Mother,-
div1.p:
I have
had another hard day.
In the morning I
went down town
and engaged my berth
to N.Y. Then I went
to the Fair and
finished up the Art
building and the
Manufactures building

The art collection
is a great disappoint-
ment. There is hardly
anything worth seeing.

I shall reach
N.Y. on Friday morning.

I shall then go
to the hospital and
pack my trunk, I
have only a valise
with me now.

At 4 I shall start
TOWER HOTEL,
STONY ISLAND AVENUE,
NEAR
65TH ST. ENTRANCE TO WORLD'S FAIR,
H. T. BLAKE, MANAGER,
LATE PROPRIETOR IRON SPRINGS HOTEL,
MANITOU, COL. AND MEXICAN GULF HOTEL,
PASS CHRISTIAN, MISS.
CHICAGO.__________________________1893.
for Hatley. If you
want to communicate
with me write or
telegraph to the Hospi-
tal so that I
shall get it on
Friday morning.

This is Maryland
day at the Fair.
They had a performance
a programme of which
I send you. I heard
the opening prayer and
a part of Mr Brown's
address. I looked
around for the Keighlers
but did not see
them there.
